messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Catholic Communion
messages.msgSnippet: ... priest ... And they rarely ring the little bells anymore.  And many parishes allow girls to be servers now.....and women are sometimes appointed as parish
messages.messageBody:
> I grew up Catholic, and was sort of horrified when, as a young adult, went
> back to the Catholic church and saw the changes in Communion. ONLY the
priest
> touched the wafer, putting it in our mouths. And we NEVER chewed! (Somehow
> chewing Jesus was just wrong.)
>
> Now the priest hands it to the person, and people chew.
>
> Kathryn
And they rarely ring the little bells anymore. And many parishes allow
girls to be servers now.....and women are sometimes appointed as parish
administrators. And laypeople are necessary to parish functioning. Vatican
2 has slowly caused transformations......though Americans do tend to rebel
in some ways...I'm not sure Pope JP-2 would think much of the female
servers. Even read recently of a new schism in the Catholic
church......someone "ordained" a woman priest.
S

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Catholic Communion
messages.msgSnippet: My uncle is a priest and I remembering being at the rectory when the communion was delivered. I dont know how I thought they got it, but certainy not from a
messages.messageBody:
My uncle is a priest and I remembering being at the rectory when the
communion was delivered. I dont know how I thought they got it, but certainy
not from a delivery truck!!! We would sneak eating it. . .thinking we were
sooo bad! LOL. . . ahhh, the memories of good ole Catholic guilt!

lovemary

I cannot judge my own path and SELF, having the knowledge that I have chosen
to come here to experience these specific issues and grow, learn, and
Remember Who I Am.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Catholic Communion
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/20/2001 11:18:24 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... I grew up Catholic, and was sort of horrified when, as a young adult, went back to the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/20/2001 11:18:24 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Once it's blessed/activated, it has to be treated really specially. The
> priest finishes any crumbs. There's a kind of ceremony if a piece is
> dropped. There are some procedures for "host to go" (like bedridden folk
> might get home delivery).
>
>

I grew up Catholic, and was sort of horrified when, as a young adult, went
back to the Catholic church and saw the changes in Communion. ONLY the priest
touched the wafer, putting it in our mouths. And we NEVER chewed! (Somehow
chewing Jesus was just wrong.)

Now the priest hands it to the person, and people chew.

Kathryn



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
